p: Sensitivity analyses were done to assess the effect of the assumptions of PIA model sensitivity and aetiology priors on the aetiology findings. Lowering and narrowing the pneumococcal blood culture sensitivity prior, or increasing its aetiology prior, had little effect on the S pneumoniae aetiology estimate, probably because of the strength of evidence regarding S pneumoniae from the other measurements (NP-OP PCR and whole blood PCR; appendix). Increasing the aetiology prior of NOS from 3% (base case) to 25% resulted in an increase in the NOS aetiology estimate from lower than 8% at all sites to 8â€“25% across sites ( appendix).
